title: Schedule to the Social Welfare (Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 2024 (No. 24 of
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Social Welfare (Consolidated
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Social Welfare (Consolidated 
Claims, Payments and Control) (Amendment) (No. 4) (Sharing of Information) 
Regulations 2025. 

(2) These Regulations and the Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, 
Payments and Control) Regulations 2007 to 2025 shall be construed together as 
one and may be cited together as the Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, 
Payments and Control) Regulations 2007 to 2025. 

Sharing of information

title: Schedule to the Social Welfare (Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 2024 (No. 24 of
heading: 2. Article 189 (amended by article 2 of the Social Welfare (Consolidated
text_raw:
2. Article 189 (amended by article 2 of the Social Welfare (Consolidated 
Claims, Payments and Control) (Amendment) (No. 4) (Sharing of Information) 
Regulations 2015 (S.I. No. 317 of 2015)) of the Social Welfare (Consolidated 
Claims, Payments and Control) Regulations 2007 (S.I. No. 142 of 2007) is 
amended by – 

(a) 

the insertion of the following sub-article after sub-article (1A): 

“(1B) The following is prescribed as information that may be 
shared, in accordance with section 266, by the Minister for Social 
Protection with the Minister for Education and Youth, in relation 
to all children aged 5 and under at the end of the month preceding 
the date on which the information is shared each year: 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

the child’s age in years, or the fact that the child was less 
than one year old; 

the address associated with the child (including the related 
Eircode if available); 

the child’s component ID being a unique identifier 
generated by the Minister for Social Protection which 
enables this information to be shared with the Minister for 
Education and Youth without the use of the child’s personal 
public service number; and, thereafter, the classification 
and analysis of that information by the Minister for 
Education and Youth; 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 8th July, 2025. 

 
 
 
 
 [293] 3 

to the extent that such information is required by the Minister for Education and 
Youth for the purpose of the planning and co-ordination of the provision of 
sufficient school places in relevant geographical areas for the numbers of 
children likely to be seeking admission to schools as junior infants in the 
following 5 years.”. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

3 July, 2025. 

DARA CALLEARY, 

Minister for Social Protection. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [293]

title: Schedule to the Social Welfare (Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 2024 (No. 24 of
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

Section 266 of the Social Welfare Consolidation Act 2005 provides that 
specified bodies may share any information that may be prescribed with the 
Minister for Education and Youth, where that Minister requires the information 
for the purpose of enabling him or her to provide education in accordance with 
section 6(b) of the Education Act 1998. 

The purpose of these Regulations is to provide for the sharing of limited 
categories of information in relation to children aged 5 and under by the Minister 
for Social Protection with the Minister for Education and Youth to further assist 
him or her to plan for school provision in geographic areas based on the number 
of children in each area. 

 
 
 
 
 [293] 5
